title: Front Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Front Brake Master Cylinder - Removal D71; D74; DR4; DS4
Note the setting of the brake lever adjuster to make sure it is returned to the same position when the overhaul operation is complete.
One of the brake calipers will require removing and the pistons pushed out to back bleed the master cylinder as part of the brake bleeding procedure, see
Remove the caliper mounting bolts and slide the caliper off the brake disc.

Using a suitable flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the front brake lever slowly until the plate is held by the brake pads. Do not allow the pistons to fall out.
When disconnecting the brake hose from the master cylinder it is necessary to keep the open end of the hose above the handlebars.
Allowing the brake hose to fall below the handlebar height will allow an excessive amount of air to enter into the brake system.
Trapped air may cause the brake lever to feel spongy and contribute to reduced braking efficiency.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Noting its orientation for installation, disconnect the brake hose, discard the washers and allow the brake fluid to drain from the master cylinder outlet into a suitable container.
Detach the brake light switch from the master cylinder.

body.name: Front Master Cylinder Hose and Switch

body.body: Remove the pivot bolt and lock nut securing the brake lever to the master cylinder. Remove the brake lever.

body.name: Front Brake Lever DR4; DS1; DSA

body.body: Release the clamp fixings from the handlebar to remove the master cylinder.
